title: Storm and stress
creator_contributor_role: Contemporary Art Television (CAT) Fund, associate producer
abstract: the tension between the forces of nature and technology
description: A line of satellite dishes stretches to the horizon as storm clouds loom overhead. A tornado funnels across a plains landscape at high speed. Through remarkable imagery of majestic natural phenomena, Storm and Stress evokes the beauty, terror and power of the tension between the forces of nature and technology. Hall's sequences are based on natural elements -- air, fire, water -- and the industrial counterparts that echo them -- wind tunnels, Tesla coils, hydroelectric plants. Hall's allusions to Sturm und Drang, the 19th-century Romantic aesthetic of the apocalyptic sublime, and the notion of the Pathetic Fallacy, in which natural upheaval reflects the individual's inner turmoil, are expressed through powerful visual metaphors.
related_objects: Collection; B1005390; Exhibition Collection; Active; 01 Dec 1998
